com.pump.plaf

Class ButtonCluster

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.plaf.ButtonCluster

  • public class ButtonCluster
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a list of buttons that are physically clustered side-by-side (either horizontally or vertically).

    When this object is given a list of buttons, it will update the button position property so all the buttons will render correctly. (This assumes the buttons use a FilledButtonUI.).

    If buttons in this cluster are made invisible: the position key for each button may change (so the button that used to be a "middle" button is now a "left" button, for example).

    This is similar to a ButtonGroup: you may never need to call it once it is constructed. It's job is to monitor components through listeners without your intervention.

    Also this optionally includes a standardized field. If this is true, then the FilledButtonUI will make all the buttons in a cluster the same approximate size.

    • Method Detail

      • install

        public static void install(javax.swing.JComponent parent,
                           FilledButtonUI ui,
                           boolean standardize)
        This is intended to create horizontal toolbars where all buttons share the same UI. The button positions are automatically kept up-to-date with a ButtonCluster object.
        Parameters:
        parent - this must be a JToolBar -- or something very similar -- where the child components are all adjacent buttons. If this is not the case then no exceptions will be thrown, but your UI will appear incorrect.
        ui - the FilledButtonUI to install on each button.
        standardize - when true then the buttons in the resulting clusters should be made the same approximate size.

      • install

        public static void install(javax.swing.JComponent parent,
                           int orientation,
                           FilledButtonUI ui,
                           boolean standardize)
        This is intended to create horizontal or vertical toolbars where all buttons share the same UI. The button positions are automatically kept up-to-date with a ButtonCluster object.
        Parameters:
        parent - this must be a JToolBar -- or something very similar -- where the child components are all adjacent buttons. If this is not the case then no exceptions will be thrown, but your UI will appear incorrect.
        orientation - either HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL
        ui - the FilledButtonUI to install on each button.
        standardize - when true then the buttons in the resulting clusters should be made the same approximate size.

      • install

        public static void install(javax.swing.AbstractButton[] buttons,
                           FilledButtonUI ui,
                           boolean standardize)
        This is intended to create horizontal toolbars where all buttons share the same UI. The button positions are automatically kept up-to-date with a ButtonCluster object.
        Parameters:
        buttons - an array of horizontally adjacent buttons
        ui - the FilledButtonUI to install on each button.
        standardize - when true then the buttons in the resulting clusters should be made the same approximate size.

      • install

        public static void install(javax.swing.AbstractButton[] buttons,
                           int orientation,
                           FilledButtonUI ui,
                           boolean standardize)
        This is intended to create horizontal or vertical toolbars where all buttons share the same UI. The button positions are automatically kept up-to-date with a ButtonCluster object.
        Parameters:
        buttons - an array of adjacent buttons
        orientation - either HORIZONTAL or VERTICAL
        ui - the FilledButtonUI to install on each button.
        standardize - when true then the buttons in the resulting clusters should be made the same approximate size.

      • getButtons

        public javax.swing.AbstractButton[] getButtons()

      • isStandardized

        public boolean isStandardized()
        Returns:
        whether buttons in this cluster are supposed to be standardized. The FilledButtonUI consults this property to determine the size of buttons. If this is true, then all buttons in a cluster will be approximately the same size.

      • getCluster

        public static ButtonCluster getCluster(javax.swing.AbstractButton button)
        Returns the ButtonCluster associated with a button, or null if this button is not part of a cluster.

        protected void updateSegmentPositions()
